content.description: Starts the same as Accipiter, but tackles the left panel with a powerful heel hook move and tensiony redpoint crux. *note: I put up Accipiter and Lonesome without the ramp beneath the overhang, and my proposed grades reflect that contrivance. Do them however you want, I think the movement is pretty enjoyable either way you choose to climb it!
Start left hand on an obvious pinch feature and right hand in a flat undercling. Climb straight up the prow via sidepulls and heel hooks.
content.protection: Two pads and a blubber oughta do ya

content.description: Prominent Feature described in The Reno Book of Boulders. (reno.bookofboulders.com/Key…). The slick hard rock yields a couple decent problems.  There is also a nice warmup on a small panel up and left of the black rock boulder. I'm not sure if this crag has been climbed before, but I thought I'd add this page in the hopes that these problems gain a little traffic. If you do have any background information on this area, feel free to message me!
